summary: The document is an agent report from the INSCOM/CSF agency, dated March 10, 1971, focusing on Henry S. Beer and his step-son Joachim Friedrich Eberhard Beer (also known as Pehl). It outlines Joachim Beer's military service in the US Army Berlin Brigade, his personal and family background, and his security clearance status. Originally classified as CONFIDENTIAL, the document was later regraded to UNCLASSIFIED with certain deletions.
key_findings: Joachim Friedrich Eberhard Beer, also known as Pehl, served in the US Army Berlin Brigade with a rank of E5.
He was adopted by his step-father, Henry S. Beer, on May 6, 1965.
Joachim Beer was granted a Confidential security clearance based on a background investigation completed in January 1967.
The document provides detailed personal and military information about Joachim Beer, including his date and place of birth, parents' information, and marital status.
The document was reviewed and regraded to UNCLASSIFIED with deletions on October 18, 1994.
